A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The original story and feel of the franchise is being shifted greatly.  While I look forward to seeing stories from this universe that don't revolve around the Skywalker family (Especially set in the Old Republic Era).  This film needed to do a better job of showing respect to it's core while shifting to a new focus.  Every chance we had to have a serious moment\, be it with the meaning of the force\, the meaning hope\, or even family\, the film went out of its way to shove in a joke.  I've seen plenty of people say this was Star Wars controlled by Mavel\, and can't disagree with them.  It felt like they just said \"Oh\, Hey Guardians of the Galaxy made us money.  It was in space\, and Star Wars is in space so their set up and presentation should be the same model.  There were many moments here that could have been used to build a truly great movie\, but they simply could not hold out  against the irreverence and useless joking around that never server any purpose to the story arc.  I am not sure if I have ever felt a movie needed to be shorter\, but this one definitely did........
